greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least k such that ((2n+1)^k-1)/2n is prime, or 0 if no such k exists.
example: a(23) = 127 because 2 * 23 + 1 = 47, (47^k-1)/46 is composite for k = 2, 3, ..., 126 and prime for k = 127.
program: (PARI) a(n) = {l=List([4, 12, 24, 40, 60, 62, 84]); for(q=1, 91, if(n==l[q], return(0))); k=1; while(k, s=((2*n+1)^prime(k)-1)/(2*n); if(ispseudoprime(s), return(prime(k))); k++)} \\ _Eric Chen_, Nov 14 2014
results.author: _Eric Chen_, Nov 13 2014
